title: Fed minutes point to ‘likely’ rate cut coming in September
content: The Federal Reserve on Wednesday released minutes from its July 30-31 policy meeting.
summary: The Federal Reserve on Wednesday released minutes from its July 30-31 policy meeting.

title: U.S. job growth revised down by the most since 2009. Why this time is different
content: There's a lot of debate about how much signal to take from the 818,000 downward revisions to U.S. payrolls — the largest since 2009. Is it signaling recession?
summary: There's a lot of debate about how much signal to take from the 818,000 downward revisions to U.S. payrolls — the largest since 2009. Is it signaling recession?

title: India walks a diplomatic tightrope, making friends with Ukraine while ally Russia watches on
content: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to Ukraine on Friday is likely to be closely watched by both New Delhi's ally Russia and by Western partners.
summary: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to Ukraine on Friday is likely to be closely watched by both New Delhi's ally Russia and by Western partners.

title: Asia-Pacific markets mostly open stronger as Bank of Korea holds rates; investors assess Fed minutes
content: The BOK is expected to hold rates at 3.5%, but traders will watch the language used in its release to see if any easing of policy are on the cards.

title: 'Pick a number': Strategist says the U.S. dollar will drift much lower against the Japanese yen
content: The U.S. dollar is likely to continue to drift lower against the Japanese yen over the coming months, according to one market strategist.

title: China calls EU tariffs on EVs unfair, says it will take necessary measures to defend industry
content: Beijing said it continues to believe the EU's probe into China's subsidies for EVs are promoting unfair competition in the name of fair competition.

title: Corporate loyalty does not pay off, HR expert says, as job hopping gains currency among young people
content: Just 23% of workers aged 42 and under expressed strong interest in staying with their companies long-term, according to a study by WorkProud.
summary: Just 23% of workers aged 42 and under expressed strong interest in staying with their companies long-term, according to a study by WorkProud.

title: Paramount special committee extends Skydance 'go shop' period as it reviews Bronfman offer

title: EV company Nio aims to build battery chargers and swap stations in every Chinese county
content: Chinese electric car company Nio said Tuesday it plans to install battery charging stations in every one of China's 2,844 counties by the end of June 2025.

title: The world's largest steel industry is going through a 'winter' amid a supply glut and weak demand

title: Nonfarm payroll growth revised down by 818,000, Labor Department says

title: Why the latest mpox outbreak is raising alarm among health experts
content: The WHO's director for Europe, Dr. Hans Kluge, said Tuesday that the outbreak is "not the new Covid" and that it can be stopped with international cooperation.
